name: Eagle's Dream Cocktail
instruction: Shake well, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

name: East India Cocktail
instruction: Stir well with a spoon, strain into a cocktail glass, and serve with a cherry.
note: Recipe by Harry Johnson, of New Orleans.

name: Egg Flip
instruction: Shake well and strain into a medium-sized wineglass. Grate nutmeg on top.

name: Egg Lemonade
instruction: Fill a shaker half full with chopped ice, add the ingredients, shake well, strain into a large tumbler, and fill with soda water.

name: Egg Nogg
instruction: Fill the shaker half full with chopped ice, add ingredients, shake well, strain into a medium-sized tumbler, and grate nutmeg on top.

name: Eskie Cocktail
instruction: Combine ingredients in an old-fashioned glass.

name: Egg Nogg (Hot Version)
instruction: Beat the egg and sugar well. Add boiling milk while stirring, then add brandy and rum. Stir until blended, grate nutmeg on top, and serve.

name: Elk's Own Cocktail
instruction: Shake well, strain into a wineglass, and add a slice of pineapple.

name: Empire Punch
instruction: Fill a large tumbler with ice, add the ingredients, fill the balance with Champagne, stir well, and decorate with seasonal fruits.
note: Recipe by Charlie Forrester, Casino—Dieppe, and Carlton—Cannes.

name: Eton Blazer
instruction: Put 3 or 4 lumps of ice in a large tumbler, add ingredients, fill with soda water, stir well, and serve with straws.
